thread.title: CNN thinks San Antonio Spur LaMarcus Aldridge is Lamar Odom
thread.title_full: CNN thinks San Antonio Spur LaMarcus Aldridge is Lamar Odom - San Antonio Express-News

author: Madalyn Mendoza
title: CNN thinks San Antonio Spur LaMarcus Aldridge is Lamar Odom
text:

Close
Image 1 of 90 CNN had a live slip up Thursday afternoon when they aired a photo of new Spur, LaMarcus Aldridge, while discussing the condition of hospitalized former Los Angeles Laker, Lamar Odom. CNN had a live slip up Thursday afternoon when they aired a photo of new Spur, LaMarcus Aldridge, while discussing the condition of hospitalized former Los Angeles Laker, Lamar Odom. Photo: Â 2013 Houston Chronicle Image 5 of 90 Johnny Manziel, the Texas A&M-turned-Cleveland Browns football player, announced he's entering rehab "to improve himself."
Manziel isn't alone, though. There are plenty of stars who took a pause for the cause in order to get their life back on track. Take a look at other celebrities who went to rehab for a variety of reasons.

Image 90 of 90 CNN thinks San Antonio Spur LaMarcus Aldridge is Lamar Odom 1 / 90 Back to Gallery CNN had a live slip up Thursday afternoon when they aired a photo of new Spur, LaMarcus Aldridge, while discussing the condition of hospitalized former Los Angeles Laker Lamar Odom.
A few people quickly caught the mistake and posted about it on Twitter.
“That’s not Lamar Odom, CNN,” Matt Wilson, an Express-News copy editor, tweeted .
RELATED: Lamar Odom's spiral leaves ex-NBA star fighting for his life
Though the two have similar names and jobs, they are in drastically different conditions.
Odom is currently under the care of a Nevada hospital after being found unconscious at a brothel where he stayed for a few days. The 35-year-old former basketball player was found with fluid coming out of his nose and mouth, according to the Associated Press.
According to the report, brothel employees said he did cocaine this weekend. He also took up to 10 tabs of a sexual performance enhancer, officials told AP.
mmendoza@mysa.com
